New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. is one shy of the NLDS record for home runs, held by Carlos Beltran (2004, Houston) and Nick Castellanos (2023, Philadelphia)
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr.'s towering two-run home run highlighted a six-run second inning
Teoscar Hern√°ndez hit a grand slam with one out in the third
Mookie Betts also homered for the Dodgers to break an 0-for-22 playoff slump
Post-Match Reflections: Fernando Tatis Jr. said he feeds off the crowd's energy
Manager Mike Shildt said Tatis likes the bright lights and enjoys performing in front of a crowd
Freddie Freeman said the Dodgers fought back after the six-run inning, but it was too big of a deficit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Petco Park, which was packed with a rally towel-waving record crowd of 47,744
The Dodgers are on the brink of losing in the NLDS for the third straight season
Others: Shohei Ohtani has been a nonfactor in the two losses, going 1 for 8 and fanning four times
